page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF AREA.
page.content: Our area covers both sides of the Conwy estuary.To the West lies the Morfa,a sandy waste,devoted mainly to golfing and summer caravans.To the East are the residential areas of Deganwy,Llandudno Junction and Llanrhos.The early municipal housing estates were built to alleviate overcrowding in the town of Conwy while much of the private housing was for retired people mainly from the North of England.However,recently, young families have begun to move into housing once thought the preserve of the elderly.Private development is continuing.The new link road to Llandudno will reduce traffic on the present roads and preserve this as an essentially quiet tree-lined suburban area.The residents look towards Llandudno as its main centre for shopping and services.
